actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Thursday, April 27, 2023,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Thursday, April 27, 2023, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 187 (Sen. Klobuchar):
        A resolution authorizing the taking of a photograph in the Senate Chamber.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

PN39:
        Geeta Rao Gupta, of Virginia, to be Ambassador at Large for Global Women's Issues

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.


 PN68:
        Colleen Joy Shogan, of Pennsylvania, to be Archivist of the United States

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.


 PN89:
        Anthony Devos Johnstone, of Montana, to be United States Circuit Judge for the Ninth Circuit

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 45. Record Vote Number: 101 



 PN163:
        Wesley L. Hsu, of California, to be United States District Judge for the Central District of California

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.


 PN289:
        LaShonda A. Hunt, of Illinois, to be United States District Judge for the Northern District of Illinois

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Schumer, at  7:15 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
